article:
'Beyond the shadow of a doubt', or 'beyond a shadow of a doubt', is a standard
of proof. The phrase means the issue in question is so obvious, or has been so
thoroughly proven, that there can exist no doubt. http://idioms.thefreedict-
ionary.com/beyond+the+shadow+of+a+doubt Two possible interpretations of
"Beyond a shadow" might refer, first, to the fact that doubt could be nowhere in
the vicinity (completely expelled from the issue), or second, to the
thoroughness of the argument (a shadow being even less substantial than a doubt
itself). http://www.phrases.org.uk/bulletin_board/5/messages/1560.html
